page.title: 02Housing in Halewood.
page.content: The housing in Halewood is quite varied, but is mainly in two separate areas. The dividing line between these areas is the railway line between Liverpool and Manchester. North of the railway is mainly the older part of the town. This consists of the "village" and quite a lot of private housing. Most of the houses are either detached or semi-detached. There is a new development of private housing to the north west of the village. To the south of the railway is all council property, except for isolated examples and private housing along the main roads.The council housing is in the form of semi-detached houses, flats and maisonettes. There are three tower blocks of flats.
